26 #ifndef REACTPHYSICS3D_MAP_H
27 #define REACTPHYSICS3D_MAP_H
28 
29 // Libraries
30 #include <reactphysics3d/memory/MemoryAllocator.h>
31 #include <reactphysics3d/mathematics/mathematics_functions.h>
32 #include <reactphysics3d/containers/Pair.h>
33 #include <cstring>
34 #include <stdexcept>
35 #include <functional>
36 #include <limits>

38 namespace reactphysics3d {
39 
40 // Class Map
45 template<typename K, typename V, class Hash = std::hash<K>, class KeyEqual = std::equal_to<K>>
46 class Map {
47 
48  private:
49 
50  // -------------------- Constants -------------------- //
51 
53  static constexpr float DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR = 0.75;
54 
56  static constexpr uint64 INVALID_INDEX = -1;
57 
58  // -------------------- Attributes -------------------- //
59 
61  uint64 mNbAllocatedEntries;
62 
64  uint64 mNbEntries;
65 
67  uint64 mHashSize ;
68 
70  uint64* mBuckets;
71 
73  Pair<K, V>* mEntries;
74 
76  uint64* mNextEntries;
77 
79  MemoryAllocator& mAllocator;
80 
82  uint64 mFreeIndex;
83 
84  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
85 
87  uint64 findEntry(const K& key) const {
88 
89  if (mHashSize > 0) {
90 
91  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(key);
92  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
93  const uint64 bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
94  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
95 
96  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; i = mNextEntries[i]) {
97  if (Hash()(mEntries[i].first) == hashCode && keyEqual(mEntries[i].first, key)) {
98  return i;
99  }
100  }
101  }
102 
103  return INVALID_INDEX;
104  }
105 
106  public:
107 
109 
112  class Iterator {
113 
114  private:
115 
117  const Map* mMap;
118 
120  uint64 mCurrentBucketIndex;
121 
123  uint64 mCurrentEntryIndex;
124 
126  void advance() {
127 
128  assert(mCurrentBucketIndex < mMap->mHashSize);
129  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex < mMap->mNbAllocatedEntries);
130 
131  // Try the next entry
132  if (mMap->mNextEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex] != INVALID_INDEX) {
133  mCurrentEntryIndex = mMap->mNextEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex];
134  return;
135  }
136 
137  // Try to move to the next bucket
138  mCurrentEntryIndex = 0;
139  mCurrentBucketIndex++;
140  while(mCurrentBucketIndex < mMap->mHashSize && mMap->mBuckets[mCurrentBucketIndex] == INVALID_INDEX) {
141  mCurrentBucketIndex++;
142  }
143  if (mCurrentBucketIndex < mMap->mHashSize) {
144  mCurrentEntryIndex = mMap->mBuckets[mCurrentBucketIndex];
145  }
146  }
147 
148  public:
149 
150  // Iterator traits
151  using value_type = Pair<K,V>;
152  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
153  using pointer = Pair<K, V>*;
154  using reference = Pair<K,V>&;
155  using iterator_category = std::forward_iterator_tag;
156 
158  Iterator() = default;
159 
161  Iterator(const Map* map, uint64 bucketIndex, uint64 entryIndex)
162  :mMap(map), mCurrentBucketIndex(bucketIndex), mCurrentEntryIndex(entryIndex) {
163 
164  }
165 
167  reference operator*() const {
168  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex < mMap->mNbAllocatedEntries);
169  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
170  return mMap->mEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex];
171  }
172 
174  pointer operator->() const {
175  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex < mMap->mNbAllocatedEntries);
176  assert(mCurrentEntryIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
177  return &(mMap->mEntries[mCurrentEntryIndex]);
178  }
179 
181  Iterator& operator++() {
182  advance();
183  return *this;
184  }
185 
187  Iterator operator++(int) {
188  Iterator tmp = *this;
189  advance();
190  return tmp;
191  }
192 
194  bool operator==(const Iterator& iterator) const {
195  return mCurrentBucketIndex == iterator.mCurrentBucketIndex && mCurrentEntryIndex == iterator.mCurrentEntryIndex && mMap == iterator.mMap;
196  }
197 
199  bool operator!=(const Iterator& iterator) const {
200  return !(*this == iterator);
201  }
202  };
203 
204 
205  // -------------------- Methods -------------------- //
206 
208  Map(MemoryAllocator& allocator, uint64 capacity = 0)
209  : mNbAllocatedEntries(0), mNbEntries(0), mHashSize(0), mBuckets(nullptr),
210  mEntries(nullptr), mNextEntries(nullptr), mAllocator(allocator), mFreeIndex(INVALID_INDEX) {
211 
212  if (capacity > 0) {
213 
214  reserve(capacity);
215  }
216  }
217 
219  Map(const Map<K, V>& map)
220  :mNbAllocatedEntries(map.mNbAllocatedEntries), mNbEntries(map.mNbEntries), mHashSize(map.mHashSize),
221  mBuckets(nullptr), mEntries(nullptr), mNextEntries(nullptr), mAllocator(map.mAllocator), mFreeIndex(map.mFreeIndex) {
222 
223  if (mHashSize > 0) {
224 
225  // Allocate memory for the buckets
226  mBuckets = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mHashSize * sizeof(uint64)));
227 
228  // Allocate memory for the entries
229  mEntries = static_cast<Pair<K, V>*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(Pair<K, V>)));
230  mNextEntries = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64)));
231 
232  // Copy the buckets array
233  std::memcpy(mBuckets, map.mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
234 
235  // Copy the next entries indices
236  std::memcpy(mNextEntries, map.mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
237 
238  // Copy the entries
239  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
240 
241  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
242  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
243 
244  // Copy the entry to the new location and destroy the previous one
245  new (mEntries + entryIndex) Pair<K,V>(map.mEntries[entryIndex]);
246 
247  entryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
248  }
249  }
250  }
251  }
252 
254  ~Map() {
255 
256  clear(true);
257  }
258 
260  void reserve(uint64 capacity) {
261 
262  if (capacity <= mHashSize) return;
263 
264  if (capacity < 16) capacity = 16;
265 
266  // Make sure we have a power of two size
267  if (!isPowerOfTwo(capacity)) {
268  capacity = nextPowerOfTwo64Bits(capacity);
269  }
270 
271  assert(capacity < INVALID_INDEX);
272 
273  assert(capacity > mHashSize);
274 
275  // Allocate memory for the buckets
276  uint64* newBuckets = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(capacity * sizeof(uint64)));
277 
278  // Allocate memory for the entries
279  const uint64 nbAllocatedEntries = static_cast<uint64>(capacity * double(DEFAULT_LOAD_FACTOR));
280  assert(nbAllocatedEntries > 0);
281  Pair<K, V>* newEntries = static_cast<Pair<K, V>*>(mAllocator.allocate(nbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(Pair<K, V>)));
282  uint64* newNextEntries = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(nbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64)));
283 
284  assert(newEntries != nullptr);
285  assert(newNextEntries != nullptr);
286 
287  // Initialize the new buckets
288  for (uint64 i=0; i<capacity; i++) {
289  newBuckets[i] = INVALID_INDEX;
290  }
291 
292  if (mNbAllocatedEntries > 0) {
293 
294  assert(mNextEntries != nullptr);
295 
296  // Copy the free nodes indices in the nextEntries array
297  std::memcpy(newNextEntries, mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
298  }
299 
300  // Recompute the buckets (hash) with the new hash size
301  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
302 
303  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
304  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
305 
306  // Get the corresponding bucket
307  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(mEntries[entryIndex].first);
308  const size_t divider = capacity - 1;
309  const uint64 bucketIndex = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
310 
311  newNextEntries[entryIndex] = newBuckets[bucketIndex];
312  newBuckets[bucketIndex] = entryIndex;
313 
314  // Copy the entry to the new location and destroy the previous one
315  new (newEntries + entryIndex) Pair<K,V>(mEntries[entryIndex]);
316  mEntries[entryIndex].~Pair<K,V>();
317 
318  entryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
319  }
320  }
321 
322  if (mNbAllocatedEntries > 0) {
323 
324  // Release previously allocated memory
325  mAllocator.release(mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
326  mAllocator.release(mEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(Pair<K, V>));
327  mAllocator.release(mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
328  }
329 
330  // Add the new entries to the free list
331  for (uint64 i=mNbAllocatedEntries; i < nbAllocatedEntries-1; i++) {
332  newNextEntries[i] = i + 1;
333  }
334  newNextEntries[nbAllocatedEntries - 1] = mFreeIndex;
335  mFreeIndex = mNbAllocatedEntries;
336 
337  mHashSize = capacity;
338  mNbAllocatedEntries = nbAllocatedEntries;
339  mBuckets = newBuckets;
340  mEntries = newEntries;
341  mNextEntries = newNextEntries;
342 
343  assert(mFreeIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
344  }
345 
347  bool containsKey(const K& key) const {
348  return findEntry(key) != INVALID_INDEX;
349  }
350 
353  bool add(const Pair<K,V>& keyValue, bool insertIfAlreadyPresent = false) {
354 
355  uint64 bucket = INVALID_INDEX;
356 
357  // Compute the hash code of the value
358  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(keyValue.first);
359 
360  if (mHashSize > 0) {
361 
362  // Compute the corresponding bucket index
363  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
364  bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
365 
366  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
367 
368  // Check if the item is already in the set
369  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; i = mNextEntries[i]) {
370 
371  // If there is already an item with the same value in the set
372  if (Hash()(mEntries[i].first) == hashCode && keyEqual(mEntries[i].first, keyValue.first)) {
373 
374  if (insertIfAlreadyPresent) {
375 
376  // Destruct the previous key/value
377  mEntries[i].~Pair<K, V>();
378 
379  // Copy construct the new key/value
380  new (mEntries + i) Pair<K,V>(keyValue);
381 
382  return true;
383  }
384  else {
385  assert(false);
386  throw std::runtime_error("The key and value pair already exists in the map");
387  }
388  }
389  }
390  }
391 
392  uint64 entryIndex;
393 
394  // If there are no more free entries to use
395  if (mFreeIndex == INVALID_INDEX) {
396 
397  // Allocate more memory
398  reserve(mHashSize == 0 ? 16 : mHashSize * 2);
399 
400  // Recompute the bucket index
401  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
402  bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
403  }
404 
405  assert(mNbEntries < mNbAllocatedEntries);
406  assert(mFreeIndex != INVALID_INDEX);
407 
408  // Get the next free entry
409  entryIndex = mFreeIndex;
410  mFreeIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
411 
412  mNbEntries++;
413 
414  assert(bucket != INVALID_INDEX);
415  mNextEntries[entryIndex] = mBuckets[bucket];
416  new (mEntries + entryIndex) Pair<K, V>(keyValue);
417  mBuckets[bucket] = entryIndex;
418 
419  return true;
420  }
421 
425  Iterator remove(const Iterator& it) {
426 
427  const K& key = it->first;
428  return remove(key);
429  }
430 
434  Iterator remove(const K& key) {
435 
436  if (mHashSize > 0) {
437 
438  const size_t hashcode = Hash()(key);
439  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
440  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
441  const uint64 bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashcode & divider);
442  uint64 last = INVALID_INDEX;
443  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; last = i, i = mNextEntries[i]) {
444 
445  // If we have found the item
446  if (Hash()(mEntries[i].first) == hashcode && keyEqual(mEntries[i].first, key)) {
447 
448  if (last == INVALID_INDEX) {
449  mBuckets[bucket] = mNextEntries[i];
450  }
451  else {
452  mNextEntries[last] = mNextEntries[i];
453  }
454 
455  uint64 nextEntryIndex = mNextEntries[i];
456  uint64 nextBucketIndex = bucket;
457 
458  mEntries[i].~Pair<K,V>();
459  mNextEntries[i] = mFreeIndex;
460  mFreeIndex = i;
461  mNbEntries--;
462 
463  // Find the next entry to return an iterator
464  if (nextEntryIndex == INVALID_INDEX) {
465  nextEntryIndex = 0;
466  nextBucketIndex++;
467  while(nextBucketIndex < mHashSize && mBuckets[nextBucketIndex] == INVALID_INDEX) {
468  nextBucketIndex++;
469  }
470  if (nextBucketIndex < mHashSize) {
471  nextEntryIndex = mBuckets[nextBucketIndex];
472  }
473  }
474 
475  // We have found the next non empty entry
476  return Iterator(this, nextBucketIndex, nextEntryIndex);
477  }
478  }
479  }
480 
481  return end();
482  }
483 
485  void clear(bool releaseMemory = false) {
486 
487  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
488 
489  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
490  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
491 
492  // Destroy the entry
493  mEntries[entryIndex].~Pair<K,V>();
494 
495  uint64 nextEntryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
496 
497  // Add entry to the free list
498  mNextEntries[entryIndex] = mFreeIndex;
499  mFreeIndex = entryIndex;
500 
501  entryIndex = nextEntryIndex;
502  }
503 
504  mBuckets[i] = INVALID_INDEX;
505  }
506 
507  if (releaseMemory && mNbAllocatedEntries > 0) {
508 
509  // Release previously allocated memory
510  mAllocator.release(mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
511  mAllocator.release(mEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(Pair<K, V>));
512  mAllocator.release(mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
513 
514  mBuckets = nullptr;
515  mEntries = nullptr;
516  mNextEntries = nullptr;
517 
518  mNbAllocatedEntries = 0;
519  mHashSize = 0;
520  }
521 
522  mNbEntries = 0;
523  }
524 
526  uint64 size() const {
527  return mNbEntries;
528  }
529 
531  uint64 capacity() const {
532  return mHashSize;
533  }
534 
538  Iterator find(const K& key) const {
539 
540  uint64 bucket;
541  uint64 entry = INVALID_INDEX;
542 
543  if (mHashSize > 0) {
544 
545  const size_t hashCode = Hash()(key);
546  const size_t divider = mHashSize - 1;
547  bucket = static_cast<uint64>(hashCode & divider);
548  auto keyEqual = KeyEqual();
549 
550  for (uint64 i = mBuckets[bucket]; i != INVALID_INDEX; i = mNextEntries[i]) {
551  if (Hash()(mEntries[i].first) == hashCode && keyEqual(mEntries[i].first, key)) {
552  entry = i;
553  break;
554  }
555  }
556  }
557 
558  if (entry == INVALID_INDEX) {
559  return end();
560  }
561 
562  return Iterator(this, bucket, entry);
563  }
564 
566  V& operator[](const K& key) {
567 
568  const uint64 entry = findEntry(key);
569 
570  if (entry == INVALID_INDEX) {
571  assert(false);
572  throw std::runtime_error("No item with given key has been found in the map");
573  }
574 
575  return mEntries[entry].second;
576  }
577 
579  const V& operator[](const K& key) const {
580 
581  const uint64 entry = findEntry(key);
582 
583  if (entry == INVALID_INDEX) {
584  assert(false);
585  throw std::runtime_error("No item with given key has been found in the map");
586  }
587 
588  return mEntries[entry].second;
589  }
590 
592  bool operator==(const Map<K,V>& map) const {
593 
594  if (size() != map.size()) return false;
595 
596  for (auto it = begin(); it != end(); ++it) {
597  auto it2 = map.find(it->first);
598  if (it2 == map.end() || it2->second != it->second) {
599  return false;
600  }
601  }
602 
603  for (auto it = map.begin(); it != map.end(); ++it) {
604  auto it2 = find(it->first);
605  if (it2 == end() || it2->second != it->second) {
606  return false;
607  }
608  }
609 
610  return true;
611  }
612 
614  bool operator!=(const Map<K,V>& map) const {
615 
616  return !((*this) == map);
617  }
618 
620  Map<K,V>& operator=(const Map<K, V>& map) {
621 
622  // Check for self assignment
623  if (this != &map) {
624 
625  // Clear the map
626  clear(true);
627 
628  mNbAllocatedEntries = map.mNbAllocatedEntries;
629  mNbEntries = map.mNbEntries;
630  mHashSize = map.mHashSize;
631  mFreeIndex = map.mFreeIndex;
632 
633  if (mHashSize > 0) {
634 
635  // Allocate memory for the buckets
636  mBuckets = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mHashSize * sizeof(uint64)));
637 
638  // Allocate memory for the entries
639  mEntries = static_cast<Pair<K,V>*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(Pair<K,V>)));
640  mNextEntries = static_cast<uint64*>(mAllocator.allocate(mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64)));
641 
642  // Copy the buckets array
643  std::memcpy(mBuckets, map.mBuckets, mHashSize * sizeof(uint64));
644 
645  // Copy the next entries indices
646  std::memcpy(mNextEntries, map.mNextEntries, mNbAllocatedEntries * sizeof(uint64));
647 
648  // Copy the entries
649  for (uint64 i=0; i<mHashSize; i++) {
650 
651  uint64 entryIndex = mBuckets[i];
652  while(entryIndex != INVALID_INDEX) {
653 
654  // Copy the entry to the new location and destroy the previous one
655  new (mEntries + entryIndex) Pair<K,V>(map.mEntries[entryIndex]);
656 
657  entryIndex = mNextEntries[entryIndex];
658  }
659  }
660  }
661  }
662 
663  return *this;
664  }
665 
667  Iterator begin() const {
668 
669  // If the map is empty
670  if (size() == 0) {
671 
672  // Return an iterator to the end
673  return end();
674  }
675 
676  // Find the first used entry
677  uint64 bucketIndex = 0;
678  while (mBuckets[bucketIndex] == INVALID_INDEX) {
679 
680  bucketIndex++;
681  }
682 
683  assert(bucketIndex < mHashSize);
684  assert(mBuckets[bucketIndex] != INVALID_INDEX);
685 
686  return Iterator(this, bucketIndex, mBuckets[bucketIndex]);
687  }
688 
690  Iterator end() const {
691  return Iterator(this, mHashSize, 0);
692  }
693 
694  // ---------- Friendship ---------- //
695 
696  friend class Iterator;
697 };
698 
699 }
